description: As one of the cornerstones of the Office suite, Word is a powerful word processor that allows users to create both simple and sophisticated documents. This series explores the essentials to getting started with Word 2016 on a Windows operating system.  We begin with basic skills such as navigating a document, selecting text, inputting basic text, and document proofing.  The series also explores all aspects of character and paragraph formatting as well as page formatting and layout.  While this series is designed for beginner users, it has lots of great tips and tricks experienced users as well.
descriptionMD: As one of the cornerstones of the Office suite, Word is a powerful word processor that allows users to create both simple and sophisticated documents. This series explores the essentials to getting started with Word 2016 on a Windows operating system.  We begin with basic skills such as navigating a document, selecting text, inputting basic text, and document proofing.  The series also explores all aspects of character and paragraph formatting as well as page formatting and layout.  While this series is designed for beginner users, it has lots of great tips and tricks experienced users as well.
name: Word 2016 Essentials
subtitle: Document and word processing software

episodes.description: Description: As one of the cornerstones of the Office suite, Word is a powerful word processor that allows users to create both simple and sophisticated documents. This series explores the essentials to getting started with Word 2016 on a Windows operating system. We begin with basic skills such as navigating a document, selecting text, inputting basic text, and document proofing. The series also explores all aspects of character and paragraph formatting as well as page formatting and layout. While this series is designed for beginner users, it has lots of great tips and tricks experienced users as well.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.025 --> 00:00:03.997
[SOUND] Hello everyone,

2
00:00:03.997 --> 00:00:08.966
and welcome to OfficeProTV.

3
00:00:08.966 --> 00:00:14.228
My name is Vonne Smith and
this is the Word 2016 Essentials show.

4
00:00:14.228 --> 00:00:18.445
I'm going to be your guide through
this journey In Microsoft Word.

5
00:00:18.445 --> 00:00:20.130
In this course overview,

6
00:00:20.130 --> 00:00:24.579
we're gonna be going over what
exactly are we covering in this show?

7
00:00:24.579 --> 00:00:25.542
Who is this for?

8
00:00:25.542 --> 00:00:28.302
What do I need to know
before I get started?

9
00:00:28.302 --> 00:00:33.012
And what other extra helpful
tips that I might have for you?

10
00:00:33.012 --> 00:00:37.311
This particular show is built
into three specific areas.

11
00:00:37.311 --> 00:00:41.750
We have our introduction,
our text formatting and our page layout.

12
00:00:41.750 --> 00:00:45.430
In the introduction section,
that's where we start from the very,

13
00:00:45.430 --> 00:00:47.344
very beginning about what is Word.

14
00:00:47.344 --> 00:00:48.648
What about the document views?

15
00:00:48.648 --> 00:00:53.091
What does it mean to be in Print Layout
versus the Reading Layout?

16
00:00:53.091 --> 00:00:54.458
What about the Word interface?

17
00:00:54.458 --> 00:00:55.189
What's a ribbon?

18
00:00:55.189 --> 00:00:56.420
What's a Quick Access Toolbar?

19
00:00:56.420 --> 00:00:57.844
Where is it located?

20
00:00:57.844 --> 00:01:00.760
So getting familiar with our environment,

21
00:01:00.760 --> 00:01:05.270
how to navigate around the document and
also how to input text.

22
00:01:05.270 --> 00:01:09.910
Daniel and I get to geek out really
hard on input and output devices

23
00:01:09.910 --> 00:01:13.730
on that episode, so definitely check it
out, it's definitely one of my favorites.

24
00:01:13.730 --> 00:01:16.920
We'll also be going over some of
the things that Word does by default with

25
00:01:16.920 --> 00:01:18.380
our autocorrect options.

26
00:01:18.380 --> 00:01:22.820
We'll do our find and replace, and some
proofing and some printing, and of course,

27
00:01:22.820 --> 00:01:25.600
don't forget, good old copy and paste.

28
00:01:25.600 --> 00:01:28.840
In the text formatting section,
that's where we start getting into making

29
00:01:28.840 --> 00:01:33.010
our text look nice, looks a little
prettier, maybe we'll throw in some pink,

30
00:01:33.010 --> 00:01:36.110
maybe we'll make things centered or
right-aligned.

31
00:01:36.110 --> 00:01:38.330
Learn all about the world of tab stops.

32
00:01:38.330 --> 00:01:41.534
We'll be learning how to
format things in lists,

33
00:01:41.534 --> 00:01:44.826
and the all important styles,
I love styles.

34
00:01:44.826 --> 00:01:48.537
That's another one of my favorite
episodes within this series,

35
00:01:48.537 --> 00:01:51.101
because so
much in Word is based on styles, so

36
00:01:51.101 --> 00:01:56.350
having a good understanding of styles will
make you a very effective user of Word.

37
00:01:56.350 --> 00:01:59.487
Then we move in to the page
layout section of our show,

38
00:01:59.487 --> 00:02:02.435
where we get into things like margins,
columns.

39
00:02:02.435 --> 00:02:06.929
We get into page numbers, headers and
footers, what it means to have a cover

40
00:02:06.929 --> 00:02:11.005
page, vertical alignment, and
the all important keep options, so

41
00:02:11.005 --> 00:02:14.540
different ways of putting in
sections into our documents.

42
00:02:14.540 --> 00:02:18.310
Another thing that Word does so well,
and that can open up the world of

43
00:02:18.310 --> 00:02:22.989
possibilities to you, understanding
what a section can do for you.

44
00:02:24.230 --> 00:02:25.061
Who is this for?

45
00:02:25.061 --> 00:02:27.320
This is for all Office users.

46
00:02:27.320 --> 00:02:29.074
Now, when I use the word office,

47
00:02:29.074 --> 00:02:33.409
I'm not saying that you have to be in an
office environment, you could be at home.

48
00:02:33.409 --> 00:02:36.760
It doesn't matter where you
physically are located.

49
00:02:36.760 --> 00:02:41.780
It's really that you want to become
a better user of Office products,

50
00:02:41.780 --> 00:02:43.430
such as Word.

51
00:02:43.430 --> 00:02:48.490
This is a very basic introduction to Word,
so it starts at the beginning, but

52
00:02:48.490 --> 00:02:53.080
it does gradually move up in
level to probably, I would say,

53
00:02:53.080 --> 00:02:55.320
an intermediate level of Word.

54
00:02:55.320 --> 00:02:58.880
Now that doesn't mean say hey,
I've been using Word for a while so

55
00:02:58.880 --> 00:02:59.870
you should skip this show.

56
00:02:59.870 --> 00:03:02.673
No, there's a lot of different tips and

57
00:03:02.673 --> 00:03:07.786
tricks throughout these lessons that
will really help any level of user,

58
00:03:07.786 --> 00:03:12.083
but it does start at the very
beginning and we go up from there.

59
00:03:12.083 --> 00:03:13.630
What do I need to know?

60
00:03:13.630 --> 00:03:15.437
Well you don't really
need to know anything.

61
00:03:15.437 --> 00:03:19.725
You don't have to have any prior
knowledge of this particular product, but

62
00:03:19.725 --> 00:03:25.050
if you have some familiarity with other
Office products, It will help you out.

63
00:03:25.050 --> 00:03:30.030
Notice on basic Windows operating system
functionalities like where is the Start

64
00:03:30.030 --> 00:03:32.493
button, what is the Windows Explorer?

65
00:03:32.493 --> 00:03:37.245
Those are some things that can also help
you to be a little bit more acclimated to

66
00:03:37.245 --> 00:03:39.190
some of the things in the show.

67
00:03:39.190 --> 00:03:43.690
However, I do have in one of our first
lessons, in the introduction section,

68
00:03:43.690 --> 00:03:48.230
where we do go over things like file open,
file save, how to close a file,

69
00:03:48.230 --> 00:03:52.390
how to close a program, and
where to find Word within your Start menu.

70
00:03:52.390 --> 00:03:56.360
So we do start with some of
the Windows basics within this series,

71
00:03:56.360 --> 00:04:01.140
because I feel Word is such an important
product and a real starting place for

72
00:04:01.140 --> 00:04:05.170
a lot of people when working
within the Office Suite.

73
00:04:05.170 --> 00:04:08.109
So I do like to go ahead and
cover some of those basics.

74
00:04:09.610 --> 00:04:12.770
What do you need to know about as well,
besides all these other things,

75
00:04:12.770 --> 00:04:14.580
some extra tidbits?

76
00:04:14.580 --> 00:04:19.330
There's always other options
to do anything in Word or

77
00:04:19.330 --> 00:04:21.340
any of the Office applications.

78
00:04:21.340 --> 00:04:25.360
So I might hit a couple of them of how to
hit it on the ribbon, maybe go ahead and

79
00:04:25.360 --> 00:04:28.820
do a right-click, but there might be
three or four other ways to go ahead and

80
00:04:28.820 --> 00:04:32.600
get the same result by doing
it in a different way.

81
00:04:32.600 --> 00:04:33.230
There's so

82
00:04:33.230 --> 00:04:37.340
many different things within this product,
you can never know everything.

83
00:04:37.340 --> 00:04:42.120
So, searching for answers is always
helpful, I do it, I still do it.

84
00:04:42.120 --> 00:04:46.491
I learn more about these products
every day and using those guides and

85
00:04:46.491 --> 00:04:51.837
using your Google or your Bing searches to
find the answers, can be really helpful,

86
00:04:51.837 --> 00:04:56.833
and also the Microsoft help files online
are actually really helpful for you.

87
00:04:56.833 --> 00:04:58.814
And updates, hey they happen.

88
00:04:58.814 --> 00:05:01.364
There are different versions of Word and

89
00:05:01.364 --> 00:05:06.315
being on an Office 365 subscription,
you might have a slight difference in

90
00:05:06.315 --> 00:05:11.470
what your environment is looking like
that might be different than mine.

91
00:05:11.470 --> 00:05:15.277
And you might walk in one day,
and like, what happened, updates.

92
00:05:15.277 --> 00:05:19.216
So, they're on either like a single
month or a four month cycle,

93
00:05:19.216 --> 00:05:22.381
depending on your organization and
your settings.

94
00:05:22.381 --> 00:05:26.451
Or, if you have a version of Office
that you have purchased separately,

95
00:05:26.451 --> 00:05:31.070
that is not part of a subscription,
you might not ever have any updates.

96
00:05:31.070 --> 00:05:33.460
So, there might be some
slight variations in that.

97
00:05:34.470 --> 00:05:39.850
Every user uses Word for a different
reason, some might be doing book

98
00:05:39.850 --> 00:05:44.780
processing, some of you might
be doing single page processing.

99
00:05:44.780 --> 00:05:47.950
Everybody has different reasons for
using the product.

100
00:05:47.950 --> 00:05:50.270
Everybody is unique in that sense.

101
00:05:50.270 --> 00:05:54.570
You start to have like a one-on-one
relationship with your product,

102
00:05:54.570 --> 00:05:57.550
that might be different than the way
that somebody else uses Word.

103
00:05:57.550 --> 00:06:00.190
So you might be talking one
day to somebody in the office,

104
00:06:00.190 --> 00:06:04.060
like, you should really do this,
because that's the way I do it.

105
00:06:04.060 --> 00:06:07.260
That's fine, to each his own,
everybody has a reason for

106
00:06:07.260 --> 00:06:11.260
doing what they have and the biggest
part is really just to have fun.

107
00:06:11.260 --> 00:06:13.630
I know that these things can
start getting frustrating,

108
00:06:13.630 --> 00:06:17.370
I've had those moments where I'm
just like why is this not working?

109
00:06:17.370 --> 00:06:21.740
But just remember to kind of sit back and
especially just watching these episodes,

110
00:06:21.740 --> 00:06:25.330
just to have fun try it out,
because that's the easiest way to start

111
00:06:26.645 --> 00:06:30.015
being a master at any of these products,
is you just gotta try it.

112
00:06:31.065 --> 00:06:32.445
Not with a work document.

113
00:06:32.445 --> 00:06:33.645
Just what can I do?

114
00:06:33.645 --> 00:06:35.085
How can I make this work?

115
00:06:35.085 --> 00:06:40.025
And that's where you can really start
to feel like you've got this program

116
00:06:40.025 --> 00:06:40.845
under wraps.

117
00:06:40.845 --> 00:06:42.097
So, definitely have some fun.

118
00:06:42.097 --> 00:06:45.048
So, I hope to see you soon,
and enjoy all the episodes.

119
00:06:45.048 --> 00:06:48.504
[SOUND]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne introduce the Microsoft Word 2016 application. Vonne describes the product’s history, how to purchase and install, as well as her setup of the Word 2016 Essentials show. This provides some background information and context for the upcoming episodes.
episodes.title: Introduction to Word

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate and explain the basic functionality of the Word 2016 application. Here you will learn foundational options like opening/closing the program, opening a new/existing file, minimize/maximize/restore, working with multiple files, save vs. save as, and keyboard layouts.
episodes.title: Word Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore the Word 2016 interface. They identify items such as the title bar, menu bar, ribbon, contextual tabs, quick access toolbar, status bar, views, zoom, and help. They also demonstrate how to customize the quick access toolbar.
episodes.title: Word Interface

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate the different document views and zoom options available in Word 2016 for Mac. Here you will see how to work with the read mode, web layout, outline, draft, and print layout views. They also cover single and multi-page view, the ruler, and zoom functions.
episodes.title: Document Views and Zoom

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne illustrate one of the core Microsoft Word 2016 foundations – navigating a document. They explain the different mouse cursor icons that you'll encounter, show keyboard navigation shortcuts, explore the navigation pane, and discuss status bar options.
episodes.title: Navigate a Document

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore the many ways that you can select text in Word 2016. Vonne demonstrates selecting text using both the mouse and keyboard to select words, paragraphs, ranges, and the entire document.
episodes.title: Select Text

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate how to input text and explain special characters in Word 2016. They talk about adding basic text like letters, numbers, and symbols like \*/%/@. They also explain the difference between backspace and delete, paragraphs and line-breaks, and tabs. Finally, they explain the show non-printing characters button’s function and dive into some history about different character sets.
episodes.title: Input Text and Special Characters

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne take a look at our well-intentioned friend known as AutoCorrect found in Word 2016. Watch as they show you AutoCorrect features like automatic formatting of lists, bullets, URLs, ordinals and fractions. They also demonstrate how Word fixes capitalization, common spelling mistakes, and a variety of other items.
episodes.title: AutoCorrect Options

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne introduce you to the revered options of cut, copy, and paste in Word 2016. They will explain the difference between cut and copy, cut/copy from within the same document, copying from websites, and copying from PDFs and other file types. They will also discuss the different paste options for matching source, matching destination, and other options that arise from specific content.
episodes.title: Cut, Copy and Paste

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue with Word 2016 Essentials by exploring the find and replace functionality. They show you how to find desired text, the find dialog-box options, replace found text with desired text, replace formatting, and replacing special/non-printing characters.
episodes.title: Find and Replace

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explain proof and print functions. They cover topics such as spelling and grammar correction, readability options, thesaurus, and Smart Lookup. They also explain the different options for printing and introduce page setup functionality.
episodes.title: Proof and Print

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore character formatting in Microsoft Word 2016. Specific topics covered here include: defining character formatting, fonts, typographical emphasis, change case, superscripts and subscripts, highlighter, font color, letter spacing, and clear formatting.
episodes.title: Character Formatting

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore paragraph formatting in Microsoft Word 2016. Specific topics covered here include: paragraph alignment/justification, line and paragraph spacing, normal paragraph style, indents, borders and shading, drop caps, and hyphenation.
episodes.title: Paragraph Formatting

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate the format painter that copies formatting from one selection to another.
episodes.title: Format Painter

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore working with lists in Microsoft Word 2016. Specific topics covered here include: bulleted lists, format bullet characters, size, color, and spacing, numbered lists, multi-level lists, continue numbering, and remove or stop lists.
episodes.title: Lists

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore working with tabs in Microsoft Word 2016. They demonstrate how tabs work by default in Word, then how to add, remove, move, and format tab stops.
episodes.title: Tabs

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne introduce working with styles in Microsoft Word 2016. They discuss the importance of using styles, identify types of default styles including the normal paragraph style, indicate style overrides and created styles, and show the location of different style panes for more options.
episodes.title: Styles: Introduction

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue to explore styles in Microsoft Word 2016. They show how to apply default styles from the style gallery, then how to modify styles and update style to match selected formatting. They also demonstrate how to create a new custom style as well as clear overrides.
episodes.title: Styles: Apply

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate style sets and themes in Microsoft Word 2016. They review the different style sets, paragraph spacing styles, and how to modify the components of a theme.
episodes.title: Style Sets and Themes

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne dive into the different elements of keep options (pagination options), breaks and columns. Vonne demonstrates the different pagination options in the format paragraph dialog box such as widow and orphan control, keep lines together, and keep with next. She also describes the importance of section and page breaks to control page layout options. Lastly, they explore formatting pages/sections in columns and column breaks.
episodes.title: Keep Options, Breaks and Columns

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne continue with more page layout options by demonstrating how to insert blank pages and a cover page. They explore how a cover page use document fields connected to defined document properties, if present, as well as formatting content generated by the cover page.
episodes.title: Keep Options, Breaks and Columns Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne dive into working with margins. Vonne shows how to control margins using preset options, individual adjustments in the dialog box, and the ruler. She also shows how to add headers and footers and explore the different options of different first page, even / odd pages, and link to previous.
episodes.title: Margins, Headers and Footers

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne continue working with header and footers by adding page numbers. Vonne demonstrates how to renumber pages for different sections as well as how to use the chapter page numbering options.
episodes.title: Margins, Headers and Footers Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne show how to apply additional page formatting elements. Vonne begins with demonstrating the difference between portrait and landscape orientation.  She continues with demonstrating page color and borders, vertical justification, watermarks, and line numbers.
episodes.title: Orientation and Decoration
